fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3902].
  {panel}

Hi
Presentation structure :

Project :                Issue type :                                     
Project 1 (P1)       Issue type A (ITA) in P1 and P2      
Project 2 (P2)       Issue type B (ITB) in P1 and P2          

Custom field :
Select list 1 (Sl1) - context (P1+ITA = default value z ; P2+ITA = default value y)
Group Picker (GP1) - context (P1+ITA = default value x ; P2+ITA = default value w)
Select list 2 (Sl2) - context (P1+ITB = default value v ; P2+ITB = default value u)
Group Picker (GP2) - context (P1+ITB = default value s ; P2+ITB = default value t)                                     
 
When I use select lists, I can customize SLA without problem but if I use group picker in order to customize automations it's impossible (error message : "Custom field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type). 
 
Please help me
fields.summary: Service Desk - Automation

fields.description:
Incoming emails to Jira Service Desk are re-formatted to fit in the Description field. This breaks long URLs, sometimes into multiple pieces. For a company processing a lot of reports, links, and otherwise, fixing broken URLs can waste a lot of time. An example of one that breaks every week for me:

Broken:
https://server01.domain.com/ReportServer?%2FConfigMgr_COL%2FSoft
ware%20Distribution%20-%20Application%20Monitoring%2FAll%20application%2
0deployments%20(basic)&FourthParameter=All&ThirdParameter=0&TimeFrame=18
0&ChooseBy=Application&SecondParameter=%25&SuccessPct=0&Administrator=Al
l&rs%3AParameterLanguage=en-US	

Actual:
https://server01.domain.com/ReportServer?%2FConfigMgr_COL%2FSoftware%20Distribution%20-%20Application%20Monitoring%2FAll%20application%20deployments%20(basic)&FourthParameter=All&ThirdParameter=0&TimeFrame=180&ChooseBy=Application&SecondParameter=%25&SuccessPct=0&Administrator=All&rs%3AParameterLanguage=en-US
fields.summary: Email parser truncates long URLs in "Description" field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3898].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*

As of JSD 3.1.0-OD-01, the portal view was changed when viewing all potential service desks. No longer are descriptions of all present service desks, rather, a list of popular / recent service desks exists now.


h3. *Environment*

JSD Cloud 3.1.0-OD-01
JSD Server 3.1.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two or more Service Desks
# View all available portals by loading https://instancename.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals


h3. *Expected Results*

A list of all portals with descriptions should be visible


h3. *Actual Results*

A list of popular and recent portals is displayed

 
h3. *Notes*

With this new view, it leaves a lot of guess work on the part of the user / customer. While there is a search available, the user / customer may not know what he / she is searching for.


h3. *Workaround*

This can currently be disabled as pointed out in the support readiness document Support Readiness - Smart Portal

*TURN ON the sd.global.portal.rt.search.disabled dark feature. The portal will revert back to the old design.*

*NOTE* Disabled the Smart Portal renders the Customize button unusable.
fields.summary: Smart portal does not allow for displaying of portal descriptions when viewing all available Service Desk portals

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Renaming a user will leads to broken JQL in reports in JSD/JIRA 7.1.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create new user 'test' in JIRA SD a make him an agent.
2. Assign a task to 'test' user.
3. Go to Project Reports , for example Workload.
4. Click on the number of Issues in progress across this agent. The list of issues will open in a new Navigator window. The JQL is:
{code}
assignee = test AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = XXX
{code}
5. Change the username of agent 'test' into 'test1'
6. Go to Project Reports , for example Workload.
7. Click on the number of Issues in progress across this agent. The list of issues will not open then. 

h3. Expected Results
Able to list the correct issues and JQL:
{code}
assignee = test1 AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = XXX
{code}

h3. Actual Results
The JQL is:
{code}
assignee = test AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = XXX
{code}
 !Selection_050.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Renaming user will leads to broken JQL in reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3891].
  {panel}

Sample scenario:

One service desk have 20 request types.
10 of them are assigned to specialist A
5 to specialist to specialist B
5 to specialist to specialist C
So button will be not enough as there are different specialists for different tasks and there is no a default specialist.
I suggest to add smth like 'Technician Availability Chart' or calendar.
If a specialist is not available on a specific date range - you can mark it in calendar. As an option - you can choose a Backup Technician rule for this period.
- Move requests to unassigned state.
- Assign to following technician
- Don't take any action on the requests.

Also it would be nice to see in this calendar all technician's requests and reassign them from current technician to another specialist if needed.
fields.summary: Technician Availability Chart/Calendar for Default Assignee in each Request Type

Steps to reproduce:
1) Uninstall an add-on. Do NOT check "allow the developer to contact me"
2) OK the uninstallation
3) You will receive contact from the developer (I have 2 instances now - the latest - Thanks for trying Clone Plus for JIRA)

Expected behaviour:
1 & 2) as above
3) nothing happens rather than the action above

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user replies to an email notification sent from Service Desk via their Outlook 2013 client, their reply gets added as a comment. However, the comment includes the "From: " line after their comment. 

h3. Environment
- Exchange 2013 (v15.0 Build 847.32)
- JIRA Service Desk 3.1.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Customer creates an issue in Service Desk via email
# Agent responds to issue
# Customer responds to email notification sent from Service Desk using their Outlook 2013 client

h3. Expected Results
Comment gets added normally 

Ex:
{quote}
Hi,

I am replying via Outlook Web Access.

Thanks,
Customer
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
Comment gets added with "From: " line

Ex:
{quote}
Hi,

I am replying via Outlook Web Access.

Thanks,
Customer
________________________________
From: Support
{quote}

h3. Notes:
As part of the {{emailreply.matcher}}, shouldn't "^>?[ ]*(From|To|Subject|Date|CC):" catch this

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: "From: " line not being stripped from emails via Exchange 2013

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JIRA Service Desk version is reported as 3.1.6, when JIRA 3.1.7 is installed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk 3.1.7 and a compatible version of JIRA Core

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 3.1.7 from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/version/1030010007
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Observe 3.1.6 is shown as the Service Desk version. 
# Access the logs and observe the following is reported:
{noformat}
    *********************************************************************************
    JIRA ServiceDesk v3.1.6 #DevVersion built 2016-06-01T01:00:01.001+10:00 - started. How can we help you?
    *********************************************************************************
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The version of JIRA that is reported should be 3.1.7 and not include the "#DevVersion" in the logs.

h3. Actual Results
As shown in steps to reproduce.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk version 3.1.7 reported as 3.1.6

Regards,
Manami

fields.description:
A customer is directed to the help center home page after attempting to access an issue using the regular JIRA issue URL. The issue is accessible to the customer when they use the issue's Service Desk portal URL. 

*Steps to reproduce:*
As a customer with no access to the regular JIRA interface:
* Create issue in portal
* Attempt to access issue using regular JIRA issue URL

*Expected Behavior:* 
After clicking the regular issue URL:
* Customer who has access to issue in regular JIRA interface - Taken to issue in regular JIRA interface
* Customer who has access to issue in portal but not in regular JIRA interface - Taken to issue in portal
* Customer who has no access to issue - Taken to portal home page (existing behavior)
fields.summary: JIRA issue URL does not direct customer to issue in portal

I would like our users to be able to self-serve on the knowledge base and would like the portals and knowledge base search split onto separate pages. 

I would like them to have the Service Desk portal links available to them, only after they have searched the knowledge base.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently we can set a ServiceDesk project to be only available for "people on my customers list can raise a request" in Request Security section. 
This makes that specific project unavailable (blocked) permanently. 
Having such option can help customers to access the hidden project(s) using the direct link of the project somewhere else other than customer portal. 

h3. Suggested Resolution
To provide an option in project level, on Customer portal settings to show or hide specific project on Help Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When creating an Automation Rule in Service Desk, if you add too many ELSE IF blocks, it will cause a rendering issue. The ELSE IF statements go outside of their container in IE11, which is a supported browser for [JIRA 7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/supported-platforms-749382629.html].  

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk 3.1.7
IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Automation Rule in IE11
# Add multiple ELSE IF statements

h3. Expected Results
The ELSE IF statements are rendered correctly within container

h3. Actual Results
See attached screenshot
 
h3.Workaround
Use another browser such as Chrome
fields.summary: Adding multiple ELSE IF statements causes rendering issue in IE11

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3856].
  {panel}

*+Problem Definition+*

as described on the following page automation can only be run as user who is defined as project default or a user who triggered the rule:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/automating-your-service-desk-732528900.html

We currently created a user "Support Desk User" to trigger our rules.
We don´t want the assignee to be the trigger because we don´t want to confuse the customer with automatic comments.
They must see that this kind of comment is an automation.

*+Current Workaround+*
We created a new "Support Desk User" inside crowd and added him to a agent specific group.
Our way ends up in consuming one Agent license for automating comments and does not work as intended.

*+How do we use those automatic comments?+*
- As you can see in our example Workflow we have a step called Freezed. 
- Behind this Freezed Status we have defined a SLA which counts 15 Business Days. After that this specific Issue will be "Reopened".
That means it goes from "Freezed" -> "Waiting for Customer" -> "Waiting for Support"
What we had here was a comment for the customer which said that this issue was unfreezed and that the support will stay in contact with the customer here. If this comment is provided by the "Support Desk User" the trigger will automatically move the issue back to "Waiting for Customer" because this rule was triggered by an agent.
 !example_Workflow.png|thumbnail! 

*+Suggested Solution+*
Provide a functional only user or another way that can be used for running automation inside the Service Desk without consuming an agent license or the need of the assignee to trigger it.
fields.summary: Provide a functional only user that can be used for running automated process

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3855].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the design for Approval/Decline button is separated from the comments. If a user adds a comment and clicks on approve/decline, the comment will be lost as the page is refreshed. The issue is transitioned but no comments would be added.
h3. Suggested Solution
# Use the functionality of a JIRA transition screen where if a an issue is transitioned, a screen to displayed to select required fields and add a comment. Click on add will save the comment and transition the issue.
# Add a warning if the comment is not added and Approve/Decline is selected, the comment will be lost.

h3. Workaround
Add a comment separately from Approving/Declining the request.
fields.summary: Embed Approve/Decline button with Comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Admin sets an automation rule to change a request type when a condition is met. However, the request type doesn't change. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation Rule as such:
*WHEN*: Issue is created
*IF*: Issue Matches *summary ~ mytest AND request-channel-type = email*
*THEN*: Edit request type Eg: 'Fix an account problem'
# Create an issue via email (Eg: For request type 'Get IT help') with the text *mytest* in the summary 

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created and the request type should be 'Fix an account problem'

h3. Actual Results
The issue is created but the request type is  'Get IT help'
 
h3. Notes
* This works when creating in the customer portal. Therefore it seems like a regression from the following issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-2520
* Test in scenarios where request types(initial and edited) are mapped to the same Issue Type and different request types. This did not seem to matter and the issue was created without the request type being changed
fields.summary: The ability to change request type via automation rules is not working

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3851].
  {panel}

h4. +Summary+
In JIRA Service Desk, there are chances that customers' accounts are stored in both writable and read-only user directories. In these cases, it's unwise to enable External User Management as customers with writable accounts can't reset passwords themselves. However, customers with read-only accounts, upon requesting a password reset, receive an email asking them to contact JIRA admins. This causes overhead to admin tasks.

h4. +Suggestion+
It would be great if JIRA admins can customize the Forgot Password page in a way that:
# customers with writable accounts can still request a password reset link via email
# customers with read-only accounts:
#* will be redirected to a relevant page (decided by JIRA admins) where they know how to proceed
_OR_
#* presented with a message including a link to that page
_OR_
#* the email content sent to them can be customized to include a link to that page
fields.summary: Ability to customize Forgot Password page to address customers from a read-only directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3843].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When sending an email to a Service Desk mail handler with issue key from other project (i.e JIRA SW project) entered in subject line, the email would get rejected and Service Desk mail log will state that "*Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist*".

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0-OD-11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in JIRA SW project. (i.e SW-123)
# Create a Service Desk project. (i.e SD project)
# Enable email request in Service Desk project
# Enter the issue key you've created in JIRA SW project (SW-123), in the subject line of your mail and then send it to the Service Desk mail


h3. Expected Results
- A new Service Desk issue will be created as the issue key entered in the subject line doesn't exist in the Service Desk project.

h3. Actual Results
- Service Desk project would reject that ticket and state that the "*Service Desk you are trying to view does not exist*". Somehow, it searches for the issue key even from other projects.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk mail handler rejects any email with issue key from other projects entered in the subject line.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Changing the "run as" user in automation getting an error

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a customer on the customer list (request security customer list) sends an email, that gets converted to a request, however if someone not on the list sends an email the email just goes to the mailbox, the user is not notified that he is not allowed to send emails to the service desk and the service desk agent does not get notified either.

We can create mailbox restrictions who can send emails to that mailbox, but that would mean double work, once on the Jira side and once to allow same customers to send to this mailbox on the mail server. 

Am I missing something ?
fields.summary: Request (created via email) do not bounce for people not on the customer list

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3839].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA Service Desk allows the customer to complete the CSAT survey multiple times, therefore ,allowing the customer to change his score and comments at any time. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable CSAT for the project
# Resolve an issue 
# Customer will get resolution notification and the option to score the CSAT
# Customer fills survey and comments
# Agent will be able to view this in the backend
# Customer can come back at any time to this resolution email and can click on the survey link

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk should inform the customer that he has already completed the survey. 

h3. Actual Results
The customer is able to refill the form and this will replace the previous survey filled by the customer
fields.summary: Customer satisfaction surveys allow customers to re-submit their scores multiple times

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3838].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Service Desk will only display up to 50 Queues even if there are more queues created within the project. Removing one of the displayed queue will show the next queue which was not displayed previously. The queue list are limited to 50. So if a project has more than 50 queues, the remaining queues is not displayed and cannot be selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create more than 50 queues in the project

h3. Expected Results
All the queues will be displayed
h3. Actual Results
Displayed queues are limited to 50

h3.Workaround
Use issue filters.
fields.summary: Service Desk Queue List are limited to 50 queues

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3836].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you want to blacklist a spam email, then you have to mark it as spam from the mail server itself. However, in large organizations where we have separate admins for JIRA and mail servers, then it would troublesome to regularly sent requests to the mail server admins to set email addresses as spam. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA admins to set emails as spam from JIRA itself, so JIRA will not process emails from the blacklisted email address.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Admin, I would like to blacklist certain email address from creating issues

h3. Problem Definition
When SD customer click Satisfaction Feedback on the email notification, it will be redirected to Satisfaction Feedback page where they can add the rating and leave a comment. However, the image on the feedback form is not currently possible to change.
!Screenshot1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
It is great if user can have an option to customize the image.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: simplificar

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3825].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

A feature request was raised and implemented about this feature:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1699

The recent update for JSD Cloud, ithis feature is now disabled due to it's creating unsolicited notifications as outlined at [What's new page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/What's+New]
{quote}
11 May 2016 -- Important Note:
We’re aware that the participants feature in JIRA Service Desk has been inadvertently creating unsolicited notifications. To address this we have implemented the following changes:
- Disabled invitation of new customers via email To/Cc fields, so only existing customers (i.e. those with an account on JIRA Service Desk) can be invited as a participant to a ticket.
- Limited the invitation of new customers to 5 at one time via the “Add People” option when customers add participants via the Help Center. There is no limit on the total number of participants that can be on a ticket.
{quote}

If an existing JSD customer CC a new customer, this new customer will *not* be added as a request participant. It requires manual work by manually adding the new customer in the list of JSD customer list. Most of the time, users may not know which new email address that their customers are adding in CC field.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide an option to disable or enable this feature.
fields.summary: an option to automatically add new customers in CC field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3824].
  {panel}

Currently, whenever the user is in a Service Desk project, the Source tab does not appear, even under expected conditions: JIRA + old Stash version.

As described here:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Source+Tab+does+not+appear+with+Successful+Applink+to+Fisheye+or+Stash
The Source tab will not appear "If the integrated applications have all the required capabilities of the Development Panel".

It should be good to either update documentation so our customers (Atlassian customers) will know that Service Desk projects do not have all default development features working. Or to implement it for Service Desk projects also.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Projects should allow the "Source" tab to appear in the issue view.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Customer has reported that the way of displaying confluence KB article is different between Help Center and Customer portal :
* From Customer portal, the KB article is display in a popup which is more user friendly.
 !2016-05-27_customer_portal.png|thumbnail! 
* From Help Center, the KB article is displayed in a new page with a smaller space to display the information.
 !2016-05-27_help_center.png|thumbnail! 

It would be better if the way of displaying KB from Help Center can be aligned with the way from Customer portal by using the popup.
fields.summary: Use popup to display confluence KB in Help Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3817].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an agent in an IT Service Desk project you will receive many request. Maybe there will be request which are out of scope of the IT Service Desk team (e.g. HR related). The HR team which can help has an own Service Desk project. In this case your IT Service Desk agent is in the customer role in the HR project. 
To help the initial customer who put his request in the wrong project the IT Service Desk Agent can only say "Thanks for your request we close this issue because it's HR related. Please go to there project". 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the ability to move an issue from the IT project to e.g. HR project.
Add an action to move to another Service Desk project. It opens a wizard. Then you choose the project, the request type, option to map a IT Service Desk input field to HR input field and give the agent the option to add the needed fields that the HR request type needs.
fields.summary: Ability for an agent from project A to move an issue to project B where he is only a customer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3816].
  {panel}

*Current Behavior*
A user must have a Service Desk agent license in order to add a link from an issue in a Service Desk project to another issue. 
* A user does not need an agent license to link from an issue in a Business or Software project to a Service Desk project. The link appears on both issues after being added.

"IGNORED_PERMISSIONS" list does not include LINK_ISSUES

*Steps to reproduce the issue*
# Create a user with application access to Service Desk.
# Create 2 Service Desk projects which share the same permission scheme.
# Grant the user with the Service Desk Agent permission of one of the projects (project A). In the other project (project B), grant only Browse Projects, Create Issues and Link Issues permissions to the user.
#* This means that the user is an Agent of project A but not an Agent in project B.
# As an Agent of the Service Desk project, use the *Create Linked Issue* option to create a linked issue in the other Service Desk project (project B) which the user is not an Agent.
# Even though with the Create Issues and Link Issues permissions in the targeted project, the Agent will not be able to create the linked issue. However, the create issue and link issue operations can be performed separately.
#* Actual result: On the Create Linked Issue screen, an error {{You do not have permission to link issues in this project}} appears and the operation cannot be completed.

*Suggested Change*
Remove veto/override for LINK_ISSUES so that this permission in project permission scheme applies to all users and so that users who are not agents can see Add Link option on issues in Service Desk projects.
fields.summary: Allow Link Issues permission for users without agent license

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add the possibility to get service desk reports using REST API

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3814].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if any Service Desk Team member makes an Internal comment, this is shared with all the other relevant internal parties for that ticket. However, the rest of the team will not be aware if the information is shared internal or with the customer too. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add markings or flag emails as INTERNAL, so that the service desk team from the email notification can understand if the information is only for internal purposes or shared with the customer.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want JIRA Service Desk to mark email notification as either INTERNAL or SHARED WITH CUSTOMER

  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

When an inactive user sends an email to JSD mail, it will not be processed (no ticket created and there is no notification)

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great if there is an email notification sent to the inactive user, letting him know that the email associated with that user is currently inactive hence no ticket will be created.
fields.summary: Inactive user should get notification email when sending an email to JSD mail

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently we have the "Restrict to articles with labels", where you can specify the label for a request. When a customer is filling the summary for a request, SD will search the knowledge base for similar content from confluence pages with that label. 

However, the customer portal search does not apply these labels when searching and displays knowledge base articles that would not appear as suggestions under any of the request types in that portal/project.

h3. Environment
Reproduced with JIRA 7.0.10 and Service Desk 3.0.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in confluence Eg: name *Page One*
# Label it as "mylabel"
# Create a second page in confluence Eg: name *Page Two*
# Go to the Service Desk "Confluence KB" page of a project
# For all request types add the label "mylabel" under *Restrict to articles with labels*
# Login as customer from the portal
# In the individual portal for this project search for *Page*. 
# Under the search bar the KB suggestions should show up

h3. Expected Results
Should only show *PageOne* as the request types in this project are restricted to *mylabel*

h3. Actual Results
Suggests all KB's
 
h3. Notes
This is reproducible in JIRA 6.4.13 and Service Desk 2.5.9

h3. Workaround
Use a specific Confluence space for the knowledge base that only contains pages you wish to share with Service Desk users. Or use another group, except  _jira-servicedesk-users,_ to restrict page access in Confluence.
fields.summary: The "Restrict to articles with labels" option doesn't restrict the customer portal from suggesting KB's other than those with the nominated Label

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If we have a "SLA time remaining" automation rule set to be trigged at the same time that SLA starts counting, when we trigger the transition which starts that SLA, the status of issue is not changing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Having two status and a transition C (from status A to status B) in the workflow
# Create a new metric in SLA : start counting when entering status B and stop counting when entering status A, set the goal to 30m with the default 24/7 calendar.
# Create a new automation rule : choose "Custom rule" > Add a "SLA time remaining" in WHEN triggers with the new SLA created in previous step and set the event to "At risk (30 min remaining)" > Add a "Alert user" action in THEN > save the rule
# Create a new issue with the workflow in question. When user trigger the transition C, the issue remains in status A but we can see that user has been alerted and the SLA has started counting.

h3. Expected Results
Issue status should be changed to status B

h3. Actual Results
Issue status remains in status A

h3.Workaround
Changing the SLA goal to 31m to avoid the conflict
fields.summary: Issue status not changing when automation rule is triggered at the same time that SLA starts counting

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Upon selecting components, every user granted with the Browse Project permission would be able to be added as request participant.
h3. Suggested Solution

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Description of problem*

"Change Satisfaction" and "Change Satisfaction date" appear as check boxes on the bulk edit screen.

*Expected behavior*

These fields are not editable and should not be visible on bulk edit screen
fields.summary: Satisfaction fields appearing on bulk edit screen

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3805].
  {panel}

As a project administrator I'd like the ability to disable the email notification a requested participant receives when they have been added as a requested participant.  

Background:
At my company a number of our infrastructure teams are looking to leverage JIRA Service Desk to communicate change and outage updates to a broad audience.  The workflow is; A ticket is created and classified accordingly.  Impacted teams or department emails/distribution lists are added as requested participants.  The team then uses the "share with customer" comment to send out 'public' updates.  Anyone on the teams can submit feedback via the ticket.  

The functionality of the requested participant is working our really well for our teams,  however there have been requests to disable this initial email notifying a requested participant that they have been added.  Blasting large email lists with this email seems redundant in this case.  Seeing as we're blasting emails to such a large number of people the teams want to make sure the communication is tightly controlled so that it doesn't become noise.

In projects where requested participants are individuals and will probably be more active we'd like to keep the email settings as is.  Changes and outages are contained in their own project and we'd want the ability to only disable the email notification only on that project.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the you have added as a request participant email notification

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3804].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When customer has set "Anyone can create a customer request via email" it is not possible to set a default reporter for the tickets raised from an unknown email address.
One use case is to notify the default reporter that a new ticket from an unknown address has been created so the default reporter can reassign it to a registered user if the customer has sent the message from an unregistered address or to forward the ticket that were sent to the service desk by mistake to the right department.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option when activating "Anyone can create a customer request via email" : When creating a ticket from an unknown address, user can choose whether to create the ticket with a default reporter or with a new user.
fields.summary: Ability to set 'Default Reporter' instead of creating new users in email channel

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3801].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Based on the 'Showing last 7 days' statement via {{SD project > Reports > SLA goals}}, it's mentioned the calculation will based on the last 7 days but in fact not. Basically, the SLAs report is calculating for ongoing tickets even if it's from a month ago are still relevant to that SLA's success. After chat with Albert Wang, this is an expected behaviour based on the code design. 

!last_7_days.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

* We understand the SLA formula but the wording can be more meaningful such as 'Showing last 7 days and ongoing issues' or any wording that would explain the SLA formula.

 
h3. Workaround 

Add a custom JQL query for the last 7 days issues.
fields.summary: Change the wording of 'Showing last 7 days' in SLA Goals

*Expected behavior*

SLA fields are not editable and should not be visible on bulk edit screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a user to the Request Participant field, duplicated users are suggested if you have the same user on multiple directories 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 directories with the same user
# Start typing the name of this user in the Request Participants field

h3. Expected Results
JIRA suggests the user once as it is done in any other User field

h3. Actual Results
JIRA displays the user multiple times as a suggestion
 
h3. Notes
* This can be reproduced either in the Customer Portal request via the "Add People" button or through the JIRA view screen in the Request Participants field
* Same issue happen for *Reporter* field but not *Assignee* field. Does not seem to affect JIRA Service Desk specifically.
fields.summary: Duplicated users displayed as suggestion

fields.summary: Email replies by reporters are registered as internal comments when using JIRA notification schemes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
There will be a lot of break/new lines betweens statement if the source email is using HTML format when trying to create an issue from email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a dummy service desk project.
# Set the Email Request (Tested using Gmail)
# Compose a new Email with new/break line for each word using Outlook and set the format to HTML
# Send the email to the Email Request email address.

h3. Expected Result:
* The description will be rendered as how the email is composed.

h3. Actual Result:
* There will be additional new/break line between the lines.
 !Screen Shot 2016-05-18 at 5.46.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround:
Use the Plain Text format when sending out email to JIRA Service Desk using Outlook.

h3. Notes:
* Tested using Outlook Client and Gmail
* Sending using Rich Text Format is reported to ignore the Break line but, this is not verified yet.
fields.summary: Extra Break/New Line added for creating issue via Email with HTML format

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3781].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

Automation condition 'User is a customer' also triggers for agent users.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a service desk automation that has 'User is a customer' IF condition. 
# Create a ticket and make sure the assignee and reporter is the an agent (your account).
# Trigger the automation created on first step.

h2.Expected Results
Automation is not triggered as expected because agents should not be able to trigger customer specific automation. There is a separate IF condition 'User is an agent' for agents.

h3.Current Results
Automation is triggered.
fields.summary: Automation condition 'User is a customer' triggers for agents

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3780].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The "Workload Report" doesn't refresh a username when the username changes. When I attempt to see the ticket breakdown by clicking on the bars on the right of a user, it uses the old username in the link, even though the bar appears correct

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the username of a Service Desk user.
# Access the *Workload* report and click on the bar under *Issue in progress*

h3. Expected Results
Redirected to the list of issues that are assigned to the user, unresolved, and part of the project.

h3. Actual Results
Getting no results found as the username used in the JQL is still the old username and not the new one.

h3.Workaround
* Changing the username to the original value makes it work again. (not preferred)
* Manually change the JQL results to the lower_user_name value in the query.
fields.summary: Workload report doesn't refresh if a user name changes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3778].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

In previous version of Service Desk 2.5.9, when an issue is transitioned to another state, JIRA will show the date when the issue was transitioned.

 !attl_sd_overview.PNG|thumbnail! 

With Service Desk 3, the interface has been changed and this column is not available anymore

*Suggested Solution*

Add the date column of the transition change back in Service Desk 3.

*Workaround*

If a user really requires this view, he/she can downgrade to Service Desk 2.X. But this will require downgrading JIRA to version 6.X as well.
fields.summary: Add date of the last change columns to the overview

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: RestroMaster Demo

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3775].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When viewing JIRA Service Desk it is reporting as an invalid version and should be upgraded, despite being on 3.1.6 already.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA Core 7.1.0.
# Browse to Versions & licenses.
# Upload the plugin manually from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions (currently due to JSD-3774 it cannot be automatically updated).

h3. Expected Results

The error banner does not appear indicating to 'upgrade' to a downgraded version.

h3. Actual Results

The error 'JIRA Service Desk must be updated to version 3.1.4 to be compatible with the installed version of JIRA Core.', despite being on an upgraded version.

h3. Notes

This can be ignored as a spurious error, as 3.1.6 is compatible with JIRA 7.1.0 as per https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk is incorrectly reporting invalid versions in Versions & licenses

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to install or upgrade JIRA Service Desk through 
Versions & licenses it fails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Either:

# Install JIRA Core.
# Attempt to install JIRA Service Desk through Versions & licenses.

Or

Attempt to upgrade JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Expected Results

The correct file is downloaded and JIRA Service Desk is installed and/or updated.

h3. Actual Results

The error "An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information." is shown as a flag notification. Additionally the below error appears in the logs:

{noformat}
2016-05-14 15:41:59,565 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-2 ERROR admin 941x208x1 4qa9 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [c.a.u.c.r.resources.install.InstallFromUriTask] Error downloading plugin from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/version/1030010021
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Accessing https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/version/1030010021 results in a 404.

h3. Workaround

Download JIRA Service Desk from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions and upload it.
fields.summary: Unable to install or upgrade JIRA Service Desk through Versions & licenses

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3772].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When customers select an KB article in the customer portal, the article is rendered in a modal frame within the page which is not easy on the eyes.

The "Did this solve your problem?" just beneath the frame is also problematic because some customers may not realize that they must scroll down INSIDE the frame to view the full details of the article.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow KB articles to be loaded in a full page as opposed to within the frame.
fields.summary: KB articles in JIRA Service Desk should be rendered in a full page as opposed to a frame

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3767].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently, there is no documentation on the "My Requests" page in JIRA Service Desk. The documentation should outline usage of the page and how the filters such as: "Created by anyone", "Created by me". "Where I am a participant" function. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The Documentation does not contain details of how the "My Requests" page works, and what a JIRA Service Desk customer will and will not be able to view from that page. 

h3. Expected Results
A Document that can be located using "My Requests", and descriptions of the User Interface elements on that page within the JIRA Service Desk documentation. 

h3. Actual Results
No page is available explaining this product functionality. 

h3. Notes
There is a short [blog post|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2016/01/improved-my-requests-page] demonstrating this feature to customers using JIRA Service Desk on the Atlassian Cloud.
fields.summary: Document the "My Request" Portal in JIRA Service Desk

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3764].
  {panel}

As a *Service Desk Agent* who must print my issues for:
* off-site support
* fresh installed hardware which waits for pick up by new employee
* e.g.

The fields like affects & fix version/s, votes, time tracking fields, etc. are in most cases not needed in a service desk environment.

The JIRA default print layout look really basic and not nice. Give it a bit more love to make it look more beautiful :)
fields.summary: Give the JIRA Service Desk print layout a modern look and feel

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello,
When two service desks have SLAs that are configured in the same way ( {color:red}even if the SLA names are different{color}), and when the ticket is moved from service desk 1 to service desk 2, the value of the SLA is not reset.
Example::
The two service desks 1 and 2 have the same SLA called "Time to take into account the ticket:
* *Start: Begin counting time when*
** Issue Created
* *Stop: Finish counting time when*
** Entered Status: Qualified
** Entered Status: support working

When a ticket was created by mistake in service desk 1, it was kept by the agents of this service desk until the SLA was breached, and then moved to service desk 2, but the SLA value was not reset and therefore agents of service desk 2 received a ticket with an SLA that is already breached, which is not fair for the team2.

Can you please correct this abnormal behavior?

Best regards,
Imane
fields.summary: SLA value is incorrect if the ticket has been moved from another service desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Service Desk Portal Date Picker Fix

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3758].
  {panel}

    We would like our Service Desk customers to be able to see the Service Desk Queues so that they can see where their requests are compared to other requests.

    We don't necessarily want them to be able to see details of other requests, though it would be okay for them to see summary info for other requests, like Reporter, Assignee, and Summary.

    In the past we recreated the Queues by using filters, and embedded those in Confluence using the JIRA macro. However, that works only if the user accessing the Confluence page has Browse Projects permissions for the projects included in the filter. We don't want our customers to have that permission, since they would then be able to access all the information on all issues. We use Internal Comments on the issue to discuss solutions among support agents, and we don't want the customers to see that information.

    We are using JIRA Server 6.3.12 and ServiceDesk v2.3.6
fields.summary: Provide functionality to show Service Desk Queues to customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the plain text format is select in the user profile the satisfaction survey won't be sent.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk 3.1.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the CSAT;
# Resolve an issue.

h3. Expected Results
The survey should be sent with the "resolved" issue notification.

h3. Actual Results
Only the resolved message is sent. No survey.

h3.Workaround
Change the Email Type to HTML.
fields.summary: Satisfaction Survey (CSAT) not sent when plain text format is selected

fields.summary: Ability to configure issue filters by SLA status (active vs paused)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3751].
  {panel}

h2. What is the problem?
Users who are logged in to Service Desk are able to see KB search results through the Customer Portal, but are forced to log in to Confluence to see the full article.
This is counterintuitive to customers because they feel that if they can see the search results they are already authenticated.
Once customers sign in once with their credentials they are able to view articles.

h2. Who experiences this problem?
This problem exists only in Server (Server/Server or Server/Cloud - if that is a thing).
One of the reporting customers is using JIRA User Directory for their shared user base which does not support SSO.
This is not a problem for Cloud/Cloud instances as they have a shared user base and SSO.
This is also not a problem if the customer is using Crowd and the JSD and Confluence instances have the same domain as this supports SSO.

h2. Why does this happen?
Searching and viewing use different auth contexts.
Search uses impersonation to fetch and return the search results from a Confluence endpoint.
This requires impersonation to be setup through the Applinks which is what the customer has done.
Viewing an article renders an iframe in the page from the Confluence domain which is why it requires further authentication (to get a Confluence session ID).

h2. How do we solve it?
Remove the redirection to Confluence by bringing the login prompt into Service Desk in the modal dialog which currently links to Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow ability to seamlessly view a KB from inside Service Desk without requiring a login for Confluence

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3750].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition 

When users log in the the customer portal there are several large friendly options for creating several different types of service requests 
However in order to follow up on the progress of these requests they have to find their way to 'My Requests'. This is a small header jammed into the top right hand side of the screen. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Adding an icon for 'View my requests' to the main portal area, or otherwise make the header more obvious.
fields.summary: Large Friendly Icon For My Requests

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center
